business.headline: India's Foreign Direct Investment up 18% in April-September, US inflows doubleThe inflow from the US more than doubled to USD 6.62 billion during the period, according to the latest government data released on Monday.

Why most early retirement plans fail: Expert breaks down the real problemMost people chasing early retirement don't fail because they earn too little, they fail because they rely on assumptions that don't hold up in real life. An expert explains where FIRE plans usually go wrong.

Airbus hit by fresh A320 production flaw as global fleet undergoes fixes: ReportThe latest snag comes just as airlines worldwide, including Indian carriers, rush through emergency software upgrades ordered after regulators flagged a flight-control vulnerability linked to solar radiation.

Govt moves to retain high taxes on tobacco, pan masala with new excise, cess billsThe Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025, proposes fresh excise duties on all tobacco products, while the Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, seeks a new cess on pan masala and other notified sin goods.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 64.77 points lower at 85,641.90, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 27.20 points down at 26,175.75. Broader market indices also weakened as volatility ticked up and investors booked profits following a record-setting rally last week.

Will RBI announce a 25 bps rate cut? What to expect from the upcoming MPC meetingWith inflation staying unusually low and the economy showing strong growth, expectations of a small rate cut have gathered pace.

Will, gift deed or trust: Which is the best way to pass on your wealth?Most families believe a will is enough, but the truth is more complicated. Knowing when to use a will, gift deed or trust can determine whether your wealth transfers smoothly or breaks down in disputes.

How lifestyle inflation, not low income, is hurting your savings? Explains expertMost people blame low income for their poor savings, but financial experts point to something else entirely, i.e., lifestyle inflation. Each upgrade, no matter how small, reduces the space for savings. Is this holding you back too?

Silver hits record high as gold shines. What's behind the latest bullion rally?The precious metals market is buzzing again as silver hits a fresh record high and gold continues its steady climb. What's fuelling this powerful bullion rally?

Cancer patients in India face health insurance crisis, finds new studyCancer patients are facing a health insurance crisis. A new study finds early detection rising but coverage thinning, leaving households to manage high bills, multiple claims and growing out-of-pocket expenses.

How smart investors maintain liquidity without compromising returnsResearch shows that portfolios with disciplined liquidity management outperform those with static cash holdings during market stress.

From ITR to TDS: 4 key income tax deadlines you can't miss in DecemberWith multiple tax compliances due this month, December demands careful attention from individuals and businesses alike. These four deadlines are the ones you can't afford to miss.

Lenskart share price jumps 5% after Q2 results. Here's all you need to knowLenskart's share price climbed to nearly 5% on the Bombay Stock Exchange around 9:37 am, reflecting renewed investor confidence following one of its best quarterly performances since listing.

Sensex, Nifty scale fresh peaks as Q2 GDP surprise lifts market moodBoth the S&P BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 touched fresh all-time highs in early trade. By 9:24 am, the Sensex was up 309.06 points at 86,015.73, while the Nifty50 rose 84.50 points to 26,287.45.

From OTPs, KYC to e-Sign: How everyday slips are fuelling a new wave of digital fraudFraudsters no longer hack systems, they hack human behaviour, using lookalike pages, cloned voices and urgent prompts. Even routine steps like OTPs, KYC and e-Sign are becoming easy entry points. Are consumers prepared for this new kind of digital deception?
HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

entertainment.headline: Shahid Kapoor says his career was an accident as he opens up about nepotism claims Shahid Kapoor opened up about keeping strict boundaries between work and family, saying his Bollywood journey was never planned and calling his career "an accident." He also spoke about fatherhood, nepotism assumptions, and why he believes children should build their own identity.

Mrs Deshpande trailer: Madhuri Dixit hunts a copycat killer in gripping new series Madhuri Dixit returns to the thriller genre with Mrs Deshpande, playing a convicted serial killer who helps police hunt down a copycat murderer. The series explores a tense mother–son dynamic, dark secrets, and a gripping investigation.

Actor Chaithra Achar says Prabhas–Hanu's period drama Fauzi is on another level Kannada actor Chaithra Achar joined the cast of the highly anticipated period war drama Fauzi, marking her Telugu debut with Prabhas and an ensemble cast.

Knives Out 3 OTT release: When and where to watch Daniel Craig's mystery-thriller Daniel Craig's mystery-thriller 'Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery' is all set for its OTT release. The film is the third installment of the 'Knives Out' film series.

Anand Deverakonda, Vaishnavi team up again for Epic – First Semester After the sensational success of Baby, Anand Deverakonda and Vaishnavi Chaitanya team up once again for EPIC – First Semester. The film is a soft love story set in London.

Troll 2 review: A predictable Kaiju drama echoing Kong, Godzilla and TransformersRelease Date:Mon Dec 01, 2025 Troll 2, the sequel to the 2022 Netflix film Troll about mythological creatures the size of a mountain, made of earth and stones, is just another Kaiju vs Kaiju action entertainer that is all about the big clashes and nothing else.

Farah Khan teases cook Dilip for wearing her sunglasses and Shirish Kunder's shirt Farah Khan shared a fun new vlog featuring her cook Dilip as they visited Neha Dhupia and Angad Bedi's home, sparking laughter with their playful banter. The filmmaker also spoke about supporting Dilip's personal growth, clearing his debts, and helping his children with education.

Samantha-Raj Nidimoru wedding: Kangana, Varun Dhawan, Amala Paul, fans send wishes Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in an intimate ceremony at the Isha Yoga Centre. Celebrities including Varun Dhawan, Amala Paul, Parvathy, Manushi, and countless fans congratulated the couple with heartfelt wishes and blessings.

Raashi Khanna on film with Pawan Kalyan: I signed it without reading the script Raashi Khanna is set for one of the biggest milestones of her career with Ustaad Bhagat Singh, her first-ever collaboration with Pawan Kalyan, a film she signed without even reading the script. Calling it a full-fledged commercial entertainer, the actor said she will continue balancing Hindi and South cinema as a conscious career choice.

After HYBE, JYP Entertainment plans to enter Indian market: Reports South Korea's leading entertainment labels are increasingly focusing on India as a key market, with JYP Entertainment planning to open an office in the country following HYBE's earlier move. This expansion highlights India's growing importance in the global K-pop industry.

Kartik Aaryan dances to Kajra Re at sister Kritika's haldi ceremony. Watch Kartik Aaryan was seen happily dancing to Kajra Re at sister Kritika Tiwari's haldi ceremony, shared via fan pages. Dressed in a white kurta pyjama, he celebrated alongside Kritika and their mother, showcasing his close family bond.

Adoor Gopalakrishnan confirms Mammootty in next film; reunion after 30 years Veteran filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan officially confirms Mammootty will headline his upcoming film, marking their first collaboration since Vidheyan and signalling the director's return after eight years.

Samantha's friend shares inside pics from actor's wedding with Raj Nidimoru Samantha and Raj Nidimoru's intimate Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha at Isha Yoga Center shines in new photos shared by Shilpa Reddy. The two couldn't take eyes off each other.

Dia Mirza calls out Bollywood's age bias, and how only men get to age into romance Dia Mirza addressed ageism in the Indian film industry. She discussed her latest projects, and highlighted the need to have a more inclusive industry, where men and women are given equal opportunities without age biases.

Dia Mirza grieves heartbreaking devastation caused by floods in Southeast Asia Actor Dia Mirza expressed solidarity for the victims of floods in Sri Lanka, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia. Amid the devastating tropical storms, she also alerted about the consequences of climate change.

Animal turns two: Anil Kapoor shares BTS pics with Ranbir, Sandeep Reddy Vanga As Animal completed two years, Anil Kapoor shared behind-the-scenes moments and reflected on the film's impact, calling it a project that "erupted" on release.

Who is Raj Nidimoru, filmmaker married to Samantha Ruth Prabhu? Amid reports of his wedding to Samantha Ruth Prabhu, filmmaker Raj Nidimoru comes into the spotlight, prompting renewed interest in his personal background and career.

Bhumika Chawla leads Gunasekhar's Euphoria, check release date here  After large-scale period films like Rudramadevi and Shaakuntalam, director Gunasekhar returns with a new-age psychological thriller led by Bhumika Chawla and Gautham Menon.

Venkatesh shoots song for Chiranjeevi's Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu. See pic A viral BTS picture of Chiranjeevi and Venkatesh from a special song in Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu has amplified the buzz around the Sankranthi 2026 entertainer.

general news.headline: Brother took cops' taunt as dare, killed him: Woman who 'married' boyfriend's bodyAachal demanded the death penalty for her parents and brothers, accusing them of conspiring to kill Saksham after his release from jail. She also alleged that her family had been threatening her and targeted Saksham because he belonged to a Scheduled Caste community.

Amid BLO suicides, Election Commission faces heat over boogie woogie dance videoOver a dozen Booth-Level Officers (BLOs) involved in voter roll revision as part of the SIR exercise have died by suicide, reportedly due to work pressure. Amid this, a dance video posted by the Election Commission of India (ECI) has sparked outrage. People are calling the ECI tone-deaf and insensitive.

Did Virat Kohli avoid Gautam Gambhir after Ranchi ODI?IND vs SA: Is there a tension brewing between two of India's most senior players and Gautam Gambhir? Eagle-eyed fans have spotted Virat Kohli potentially snubbing Gambhir after the 1st ODI.

Video: Army test-fires BrahMos missile, showcases long-range strike powerConducted by a Southern Command BrahMos unit with support from the Andaman & Nicobar Command, the test validated the missile's accuracy, guidance and control systems.

Samantha's friend shares inside pics from actor's wedding with Raj NidimoruSamantha and Raj Nidimoru's intimate Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha at Isha Yoga Center shines in new photos shared by Shilpa Reddy. The two couldn't take eyes off each other.

H-1B petitions approved for Indian tech firms drop to 10-year low amid AI pushH-1B petitions approved for Indian IT firms fell sharply in FY 2025, with the top seven securing just 4,573 visas for initial employment, a 70% decline from 2015. TCS was the only Indian firm among the Top 5, with American companies hiring foreign talent for AI tech projects.

Something irreversible being hidden: Sons fear for Imran Khan in death cellThe sons of former Pakistani PM Imran Khan have claimed that authorities are concealing "something irreversible" about his condition, after more than three weeks have passed with no proof of life. This claim comes days after one of his sons alleged that Imran Khan has been kept in "solitary confinement in a death cell with zero transparency".

Muslims should give up Gyanvapi masjid, Hindus must stop new demands: Ex-ASI chiefFormer Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) regional director KK Muhammed pointed out that Mathura and Gyanvapi are two other places, apart from Ram Janmabhoomi, that are "as important for the Hindu community as Mecca and Medina are for Muslims." He warned that pursuing additional claims would not resolve the issue and could lead to further conflict.

Why Jaya Bachchan's classist paparazzi remarks deserve pushbackJaya Bachchan's recent comments on paparazzi have been called classist and dismissive. Here's a deep dive into why her remarks cross the line and what they reveal about power and privilege.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

India orders phone makers to install government cyber safety app in every phoneThe Indian government has reportedly sent an order privately instructing all major smartphone makers to preload a non-deletable, state-owned cybersecurity application, 'Sanchar Saathi,' on every new device within 90 days.

No power tussle, Karnataka united: DK Shivakumar ahead of second breakfast meetIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar said there was no power tussle with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah. He said he planned to visit Delhi soon to meet Union Ministers before the Belagavi session.
'What's that ring?' Jewellery designers decode Samantha's unique wedding pickSamantha first gave a glimpse of her unique ring in an Instagram post in February this year.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Privacy nightmare: Your personal data is now out in the open — just a click away!The website ProxyEarth.org has a sleek, easy-to-use user interface. All you have to do is input an Indian mobile number.

Nanded caste murder: Man killed by girlfriend's family days before 21st birthdayPolice say Aanchal's father and brothers shot him and attacked him with an axe, after which Aanchal symbolically married his body by applying haldi and sindoor. She claimed Saksham, who belonged to an SC community, was targeted for his caste and alleged police involvement in the murder.

How do people get scammed online? We talked to a scammerAlmost daily we see stories about people losing lakhs of rupees to some online scam or the other. Recently we got details of a scammer and then talked to him to understand how cyber scammer try to trap victims.

Can anti-India lawmaker Ilhan Omar be deported from US amid fraud claims?Allegations of marriage and immigration fraud against Ilhan Omar, known for her anti-India stand, have resurfaced again, and a section of American citizens are demanding her denaturalisation and deportation from the US. But is it possible to do so for a naturalised US citizen, who is also an elected Democratic representative?

Trump unsure what body part scanned but insists MRI results 'perfect'The White House has not specified why the test was conducted, only stating it was part of his routine physical and that he remains in "exceptional physical health."

PM says delivery, not drama, needed in Parliament, Priyanka Gandhi hits backAfter Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the Opposition to focus on delivery and not drama in the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra hit back, saying raising issues in the House was not drama.

Nandamuri Balakrishna at 65: Last man standing of the genre he shapedWhile most senior stars have moved to sleeker, subtler and more modern formats of storytelling, Nandamuri Balakrishna continues to headline films filled with physics-defying action and unapologetic mass extravagance.
Pre-screening social media content is futile exercise, will lead to misuseAt the moment there are just arguments and no order. But when the Supreme Court remarks on something, it carries a weight.

US hit 1.17 million foreign students, a record. But new arrivals fell sharplyThe Open Doors Report 2025 shows that the total international students in the US rose by 4.5% to a record 1,177,766. Yet new international enrolments fell by 7.2% to 277,118. Here's more about this twist.

Putin's India visit to revive big-ticket defence deals, new S-400 offer on tableAs Russian President Vladimir Putin is set for his first visit to India on December 4-5, since the Russia-Ukraine war, high-level defence cooperation and a new S-400 missile deal are expected to lead the agenda.

Ranveer Singh joins Jasmine Sandlas, Hanumankind to perform Dhurandhar title trackThe music launch of Dhurandhar brought together Ranveer Singh, Jasmine Sandlas, Hanumankind and Madhubanti Bagchi. Ranveer, along with Jasmine Sandlas and Hanumankind, performed the title track, giving audiences a first look at the film's music.

Shahid Kapoor says his career was an accident as he opens up about nepotism claimsShahid Kapoor opened up about keeping strict boundaries between work and family, saying his Bollywood journey was never planned and calling his career "an accident." He also spoke about fatherhood, nepotism assumptions, and why he believes children should build their own identity.

sports.headline: Lamine Yamal is not trying to be Lionel Messi: My football is about fun Barcelona talisman Lamine Yamal has said that he is not trying to mimic Lionel Messi. In a bold interview, Yamal explained that Messi knows very well that he is not attempting to copy the latter's legacy at Barcelona.

Ranchi airport cheers for Team India as the victorious team leaves city. Video IND vs SA: The Ranchi airport cheered in unison for the Indian team as they left for Raipur for their second ODI of the series. The Indian team emerged victorious against South Africa in Sunday's game.

Sports minister set for special meeting with ISL, I-League clubs and stakeholders With Indian football stuck in a commercial and structural deadlock, the sports ministry has stepped in. Mansukh Mandaviya's meeting with ISL and I-League stakeholders on December 3 may shape the immediate future of domestic competitions.

After World Cup heroics, Railways hands promotion to injured star Pratika Rawal Injured World Cup hero Pratika Rawal has been handed a promotion by her employer Indian Railways. She was promoted from the position of senior clerk to the officer rank.

Red Bull apologises for slanderous Kimi Antonelli comments in Qatar GP F1: Red Bull made a public apology to Mercedes' Kimi Antonelli for making slanderous remarks against the driver in the final moments of the Qatar GP. Max Verstappen's race engineer had alleged that Antonelli had willingly conceded a position to Lando Norris.

Hardik Pandya returns from injury to play domestic cricket for Baroda in SMAT Hardik Pandya's long injury layoff is set to end with his return for Baroda in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. His domestic comeback will determine how quickly he can slot back into India's T20I plans.

Shubman Gill begins rehab ahead of South Africa T20Is IND vs SA: Shubman Gill's return to action now hinges on his COE fitness clearance after a three-week injury layoff. India await the medical report with the South Africa T20Is approaching quickly.

Travis Head ready to open in Brisbane amid Usman Khawaja's fitness concerns Travis Head is ready to open again in the second Ashes Test in Brisbane if required. His comments come amid fitness concerns for Usman Khawaja for the pink-ball Test.

Enjoy Rohit and Virat's cricket, stop worrying about World Cup: Pathan IND vs SA: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan wants the fans to enjoy the cricket of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, instead of worrying about their eligibility for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Pathan heaped praise on the senior batters after India's win over South Africa in the 1st ODI.

Dale Steyn hails Kohli's work ethic at 37: People of his age hate leaving homeDale Steyn praised Virat Kohli's relentless commitment and physical fitness after the Indian batter's 52nd ODI hundred led India to victory in the opening match against South Africa in Ranchi.

Felt like we went back 8-9 years: India teammates in awe of Kohli's Ranchi knockVirat Kohli's India teammates were left in awe of the star batter after his vintage hundred during the Ranchi ODI against South Africa on Sunday, November 30. Kohli scored his 52nd ODI hundred to help India win the match.

Lucas Paqueta slams FA after red card for lack of support in spot-fixing probeLucas Paqueta condemned the FA's lack of psychological support following his red card against Liverpool. The midfielder, recently cleared of spot-fixing allegations, linked his on-pitch behaviour to the mental toll from the investigation.

IPL 2026: Chinnaswamy games in doubt as government orders safety clearanceThe Indian Premier League matches in Bengaluru are under cloud with the government ordering safety clearances for the M Chinnaswamy stadium. The move comes after the infamous stampede incident earlier this year.

Praggnanandhaa becomes co-leader at London Chess Classic OpenGM Praggnanandhaa and Velimir Ivic share the lead at the London Chess Classic Open 2025 after six rounds. The duo is set to face-off next in the seventh round.

Usman Khawaja doesn't need advice to turn around form slump: Marnus LabuschagneMarnus Labuschagne has backed Usman Khawaja as the Australian opener is currently going through a rough patch of form. Khawaja's position in the team has been questioned after his horrendous run in 2025.

F1 title showdown: How Norris, Verstappen and Piastri can win title in Abu DhabiThe Formula One 2025 season is set for a thrilling climax as Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri battle it out for the crown. Here's how all three drivers can walk away with the crown in the Abu Dhabi GP on December 7.

Don't judge Ruturaj Gaikwad for low scores until you make him open: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has called for giving Ruturaj Gaikwad a chance as an opener before judging his ODI career. Without Kohli and Rohit, India had no chance vs South Africa in Ranchi: KaifMohammed Kaif has claimed that without the heroics from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, India would have lost the Ranchi ODI against South Africa. Kohli scored a hundred and Rohit hit a fifty as India won the match by 17 runs.

10-man Chelsea frustrate Arsenal, Liverpool end rot vs West HamChelsea held Arsenal to a 1-1 draw despite being reduced to ten men. Liverpool defeated West Ham 2-0, with Alexander Isak scoring his first Premier League goal for the club as the Reds ended a difficult stretch of form.

Grew up watching Kohli on TV, bowling to him is fun yet annoying: Marco JansenSouth Africa's Marco Jansen reflected on the difficulty and enjoyment of bowling to Virat Kohli after India's 17-run win in the opening ODI. Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred helped India take a 1-0 lead in the series, while Jansen shared candid insights into the challenge of facing the Indian star.

If not for Rana's early wickets, SA would've easily chased 350: Sitanshu KotakHarshit Rana's early wickets helped India defend 349 against South Africa in Ranchi. He finished the match with figures of 3/65 in ten overs helping India register a 17-run victory.

Indian team least bothered, concerned about SA coach's grovel remark: KotakIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak says the team is unfazed by South Africa coach, Shukhri Conrad's "grovel" remark after the Ranchi ODI, stressing focus remains on performance.

Don't ask any questions, Virat and Rohit have sealed World Cup spots: SrikkanthFormer India selector Kris Srikkanth feels that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have already sealed their spots for World Cup 2027 and no questions should be asked on their places in the squad for the tournament.

Harsha Bhogle reveals chat with Kohli before question on Test comeback rumoursIndian commentator Harsha Bhogle revealed his conversation with Virat Kohli before asking him about his Test comeback rumours. Despite speculation, Kohli confirmed he will continue playing only ODIs, ruling out a Test comeback.

Max Verstappen wins Qatar GP to ensure three-way title showdown in Abu DhabiMax Verstappen secured his third consecutive win at the Qatar Grand Prix, to push the championship battle into a three-way tussle inAbu Dhabi. Norris's lead was reduced to 12 points following a fourth-place finish, with McLaren's strategy calls under scrutiny.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
